2 missiles in Luhansk Oblast changed course to the south/southeast, flying past Rovenky to Rostov-on-Don

2-4 missiles are flying to Temyruk, Krasnodar Krai. The port there was under attack from UAVs earlier. Russian air defence is working from Krasnodar Krai.
2 missiles changed course to the east, flying past Novocherkassk, Rostov Oblast.
Missile strikes were carried out on the Novoshakhtinsk Oil Refinery, Rostov Oblast.
Missile strikes were carried out on the Novoshakhtinsk Oil Refinery, Rostov Oblast.
The fire at the Novoshakhtinsk Oil Refinery is growing
It seems to be all clear for Crimea and Krasnodar Krai. The missiles flying to attack Temryuk were likely all shot down.

More from Novoshakhtinsk Oil Refinery, Rostov Oblast.
Russian censorship sucks lol

Approximate routes of the Storm Shadow cruise missiles used by Ukraine during this attack.
~8 missiles were used in total, likely launched from 2 Su-24s near Kryvyi Rih, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, and 2 Su-24s near Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast.
2 impacts were recorded to the Novoshakhtinsk Oil Refinery in Rostov Oblast. 
The other 6 missiles were likely shot down (2 over Russian-controlled Kherson Oblast, 2 over Russian-controlled Luhansk Oblast, and 2 over the Sea of Azov).

In the Dobropillya direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations and have made additional progress over the last 10 days.
In the west, Russian forces consolidated in the rest of Nove Shakhove following earlier infiltrations, allowing for them to accumulate and begin attacks on Vilne. They subsequently advanced north up three parallel treelines, capturing new positions there. Unsuccesful attacks were then then carried out on Vilne. 
In the east, Russian forces began pushing northwest from the gulley west of Shakhove and captured new positions in the forested areas in the direction of the clay quarries. 
+ ~3.54 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.  
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Stepnohirsk direction, Russian forces continued to rapidly advance over the last week, further collapsing Ukrainian defences. 
In the west, Russian forces consolidated in the remaining parts of southern Prymorske dachas and continued advancing in southern Prymorske. They captured the entirety of the residential area south of the first gulley, while DRGs advanced further north to the second gulley and the village centre. The Russians then advanced west along the first gulley towards the pumping station, linking up with other assault groups who consolidated along the E-105 Highway. DRGs then infiltrated further along the highway and reached the large forest east of Prymorske.
To the east, Russian forces managed to consolidate in the treelines north of Stepnohirsk following earlier attacks and are attempting to infiltrate further north. They also captured the rest of the treeline stretching west from the solar field. 
In the east, Russian forces consolidated in the treelines southwest of Lukyanivske following earlier attacks and began advancing further west down the treelines in the direction of Pavlivka. This was done in coordination with attacks along the treelines on the tactical heights north of Stepove. 
+ ~26.13 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Orikhiv direction, Russian forces resumed their assault operations and have made new progress in two different areas.
In the west, Russian forces began pushing northwest from the area of Nesteryanka and captured a series of fortifications along six parallel treelines which had held since 2023. 
To the east, Russian forces resumed their assault operations in Mala Tokmachka. They recaptured the railway station and positions in the nearby streets and began attacking the ruins of the prison. 
+ ~3.79 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Hulyaipole direction, Russian forces continued to advance in Hulyaipole and are coming closer to completely capturing the city.
In the south, Ukrainian forces continued to incrementally withdraw from the 2023 fortifications due to the threat of encirclement, allowing for the Russians to secure additional positions in two different treelines. They also improved their positions in the nearby forest plantations.
To the north, Russian forces captured additional positions in the low-rise residential areas on Nova and Petrovskoho Streets. They also continued clearing the city centre and captured the remaining three-story apartment buildings there.
To the northwest, the Russians bypassed the rest of the city centre from the north and entrenched along the eastern part of Travnya 1st street, and in the surrounding areas. They also continued expanding their zone of control in the northwestern part of Hulyaipole, and broke through Ukrainian positions on Ally Onoshko Street towards the westernmost edge of the city.
+ ~4.96 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Hulyaipole direction, Russian forces continued to advance in Hulyaipole and are coming closer to completely capturing the city.  In the south, Ukrainian forces continued to incrementally withdraw from the 2023 fortifications due to the threat of encirclement‚Ä¶
Russian forces now control approximately 83% of Hulyaipole.

In the Novopavlivka direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations and have advanced in three different areas.
In the west, Russian forces advanced in the northwestern part of Ivanivka and have begun attempts at consolidating in part of Ukraine's main defensive line to the north. They also improved their positions in the southern streets, reaching the village centre. Currently, the rest of Ivanivka is in the grey-zone, with both Russian and Ukrainian forces holding overlapping temporary positions throughout it in a very fluid and dynamic situation. 
In the east, Russian forces continued to slowly advance southwest of Novopavlivka. They improved their positions north of the fortified forest and captured new positions in the forested areas there. 
+ ~1.99 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Dobropillya direction, both Russian and Ukrainian forces have advanced over the last 10 days, with Ukrainian forces making significant progress in a series of coordinated counterattacks.
North of Pokrovsk, Ukrainian forces launched a mechanised assault towards the northwestern outskirts of Pokrovsk. They managed to recapture the two pig farm complexes and a series of treeline positions, however the attack on the outskirts of the city, which involved Abrams tanks from the 425th Separate Assault Regiment "Skala", was ultimately repelled.
In Rodynske, Ukrainian forces have resumed their assault operations in the city. They advanced east from their strongpoints and entered the southeastern streets, outflanking Russian positions in the city centre. They cleared part of the low-rise residential area there and entrenched in the western part of the southeastern high-rise micro-district, which the Russians are now bombing with FAB glide-bombs. They also entrenched in a number of 3-story-buildings in western Rodynske.
Northeast of Rodynske, Ukrainian forces have made significant progress over the last 10 days. They recaptured the southern part of Suhketske and broke through to the Krasnolymanskaya Mine, establishing full control over this crucial stronghold. Building on their momentum, they advanced further east to one of the ventilation shafts for the mine, capturing it and the surrounding areas. Russian forces subsequently carried out a massive, mechanised assault consisting of around 40 heavy and light vehicles of various types on the ventilation shaft, which was repelled with heavy losses. 
In Myrnohrad, Russian forces continued finalising their clearing operations in the central and northern parts of the city. They managed to complete the capture of the city centre and secured the rest of the residential areas to the west. They also continued clearing the northern streets, consolidating in the low-rise residential streets south and southeast of the cemetery.
+ ~10.84 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
+ ~0.79 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

Russian forces have captured the village of Novomarkove, Rai-Oleksandrivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~63.
Total land area: ~0.65 km¬≤.
The fighting for Novomarkove lasted <10 days.

Russian forces have recaptured the village of Varachyne, Khotin direction, Sumy Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~62.
Total land area: ~0.37 km¬≤.
The fighting for Varachyne lasted approximately 75 days.

A Russian soldier is seen draping the flag of the 57th Brigade over the statue of Nestor Makhno in the city centre of Hulyaipole. 
Coordinates: 47.666078, 36.2529328

David is so annoyed at me for reporting about the reality in Ukraine that he is now openly lying about me, beyond just speculative opinions. The only time I ever spoke to him through a call was in a public space prior to him blocking and condemning me. I have never had a private call with him, and the fact that he is lying to himself and others shows how desperate he is. 
It seems like every couple of weeks he has another little meltdown, calling me Pro-Russian and the closest friend of @.squatsons. But what's funny is that he can't even get his info about me correct.
David is an American boomer, indoctrinated since birth, who is now spouting his nonsense online to an ever-shrinking audience of comfort-media-consumers. He's someone that you should never take seriously, unless you like being lied to.
But don't worry, his grift will be over soon. Any form of reputation he still has will be lost once this war is over, as people realise that he has lied about everything. I have a whole catalogue of stupid things he's posted that have aged terribly and contradicted earlier statements he's made. Perhaps I should post them at some point?

Russia Systematically Dismantles Ukraine's Energy Infrastructure Amid Mutual Strikes
The Ukrainian Air Force reported that on the night of December 25, Russian forces launched 131 attack drones, of which 106 were intercepted or suppressed by air defense systems. At the same time, the Russian side stated that it had destroyed 141 Ukrainian drones
.
Reports indicate that the dynamics of strikes on Ukrainian territory continue to demonstrate Russia's strategic goal: the systematic dismantling of Ukraine's energy system, particularly in northern regions. In recent days, key substations in Chernihiv and Sumy regions have been targeted. This tactic pursues a pragmatic objective ‚Äî isolating the combat zone by disrupting energy supply. The northern corridor is critically important for the Ukrainian army as a route for deploying reserves. Strikes on energy facilities aim to narrow this window of opportunity, complicate logistics, and deprive regions of resilience.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

From Siversk To Slaviansk: Russian Army Fights Ukrainian Forces For Reznykivka And Zakotne
In the Sumy sector, Russian units are advancing on a broad front up to 700 meters deep. After seizing control of the center and eastern part of Andriivka, they expanded their sphere of influence in the Krasnopillia district. 
And in the Slaviansk sector, Russian units established full control over Sviato-Pokrovske, paving the way for a further advance to the west. Heavy fighting continues in Zakotne, where Ukrainian forces, capturing the high ground, are trying to impede the advance. 
Meanwhile, in the Zaporizhzhia sector, Russian assault units are consolidating bridgeheads on the left bank of the Haichur River. They fully control Andriivka and are fighting for Bratske and Huliaipole.
These military successes unfold against a backdrop of mounting criticism of the European strategy. Some politicians deem it a "dangerous path" that prolongs the conflict and refuses dialogue.
Read more 
HERE

U.S. Launches Strikes In Nigeria In Response To Killing Of Christians (Video, Photos)
President Donald Trump announced on December 25 that the United States military conducted ‚Äúpowerful and deadly‚Äù strikes against ISIS targets in northwestern Nigeria, well over a month after warning the West African nation over the issue.
‚ÄúTonight, at my direction as Commander in Chief, the United States launched a powerful and deadly strike against ISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria, who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians, at levels not seen for many years, and even Centuries!‚Äù Trump wrote on his Truth Social network.
‚ÄúI have previously warned these Terrorists that if they did not stop the slaughtering of Christians, there would be hell to pay, and tonight, there was,‚Äù the president continued."

Over 20 Killed Or Wounded In Blast At Alawite Mosque In Syria‚Äôs Homs (18+ Videos)
Over 20 people were killed or wounded in the central Syrian city of Homs on December 26 as a result of a blast inside a mosque in the Alawite-majority neighborhood of Wadi al-Dahab.
In a statement, the Syrian Ministry of Interior said that a ‚Äúterrorist bombing‚Äù targeted the Ali bin Abi Talib Mosque during Friday prayers, adding that security forces were dispatched to the scene of the attack and an investigation was launched.
The state-run SANA news agency reported, citing a security official, that the blast was caused by ‚Äúmultiple explosive devices,‚Äù although the media director in Homs told Al-Jazeera that a single explosive device was planted inside the mosque.
üëâ
